arts.ttl: Michael Carrick at pains to have to repeat himself after latest Middlesbrough loss
arts.sum: But the game is about scoring goals and we need to find a way of doing that. We’re finding it difficult at the minute, but it’s very different from thinking, where is the next goal coming from?

arts.ttl: EFL highlights, reports, tables: Burnley go top | Wrexham, Blues win
arts.sum: Championship highlights, table & scores Championship reports & highlights

arts.ttl: Bristol City beat Middlesbrough without head coach Liam Manning
arts.sum: Manning is currently away from the club following the death of his son Theo.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough's Bristol City hoodoo continues as the same problems cost them again in defeat
arts.sum: For all their pretty football, they ultimately lacked a cutting edge to make it count before shooting themselves in the foot with self-inflicted goals from Anis Mehmeti and Yu Hirakawa, condemning Boro to defeat. Boro continued to probe and the visitors looked to be hanging on to try and preserve their half-time lead.

arts.ttl: Bristol City coach shuts down Tommy Conway reunion talk amid glowing Middlesbrough assessment
arts.sum: Bristol City assistant head coach Chris Hogg admits it will be a difficult day for his players at Middlesbrough in the context of the absence of manager Liam Manning. Hogg said: "In terms of after the week we’ve had, to go there to try and express ourselves and try and compete and be hard to beat, and go and do what we do, really - and go and get back to showing what Bristol City can be all about: Together, fighting to win a football game, but trying to do it our way, which is the challenge.

arts.ttl: Hackney starts: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Bristol City
arts.sum: The latest Middlesbrough team news as Michael Carrick's side gear up to face Bristol City in the Championship. The post Hackney starts: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Bristol City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Boro must manage emotional day as Michael Carrick dismisses Bristol City theory
arts.sum: 'Devastated' Middlesbrough boss Michael Carrick described it as the 'least we could do' as Boro showed their class by immediately contacting Bristol City officials and arranging with them to have a minute's applause ahead of the game. In that context, it almost feels flagrant to think about the match and the importance of Boro bouncing back from the pre-international break defeat to Watford.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick delivers his verdict on Neto Borges' start at Middlesbrough with adapting point
arts.sum: Michael Carrick is really pleased with Neto Borges's integration into the Middlesbrough side, insisting he's adapted just fine to life on Teesside, despite some struggles with the tactical intricacies of his role. He has shown plenty of positives in possession so far, albeit without any assists to show for it as of yet, while Carrick would likely view the first Watford goal as a team problem as Boro were caught in transition, leaving Borges exposed.

arts.ttl: Former Middlesbrough boss Steve McClaren explains why Jamaica role 'excites' him
arts.sum: Steve McClaren says the potential of Jamaica's national team excited him after a recent FIFA analyst role, which ultimately led to the former Middlesbrough boss becoming the new head coach. McClaren started working as a FIFA technical director three years ago, and part of his remit became analysing Jamaica, which is when he says he was first alerted to their exciting potential.

arts.ttl: Rav van den Berg makes exciting promise after winning another Middlesbrough award
arts.sum: Rav van den Berg promises there is still a lot more to come from him in a Middlesbrough shirt as he collected another award after his excellent first season at the club. He turned down some major European clubs to move to Boro, with his main ambition to play games regularly to continue his exciting development.
